intro: Pentaschistis exserta, commonly known as the rock lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with six petals that are reflexed at the tips. It is a perennial herb that is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
